page.title: 03PONTSTICILL TODAY 1985
page.content: The little village of Pontsticill has decreased considerably in importance since it's prime years in the 1800's. The village used to have two chapels and one church,now only the church in Vaynor is in use.There used to be a Post Office and also a shop,but they closed down a few years ago because they were not being used enough.Today the children of the village have to travel three and a half miles to the nearest school.The old village school closed down many years ago because there were too few children. Now there only three pubs in the village,they are the Red Cow Inn, the Butcher's Arms and the Church Tavern.It is called the Church Tavern because it is right next to Vaynor Church.In Pontsticill itself there is a popular riding school with fifteen horses.
